org.jetel.metadata

Class DataFieldMetadata

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jetel.metadata.DataFieldMetadata
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class DataFieldMetadata
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A class that represents metadata describing one particular data field.
    Handles encoding of characters.
    Since:
    26th March 2002
    See Also:
    DataRecordMetadata, Serialized Form

      • getDelimiter

        public java.lang.String getDelimiter()
        Returns:
        the delimiter string

      • getDelimiters

        public java.lang.String[] getDelimiters()
        Returns an array of all field delimiters assigned to this field. In case no field delimiters are defined, default field delimiters from parent metadata are returned. Delimiters for last field are extended by a record delimiter.
        Returns:
        the array of all field delimiters

      • getDelimiters

        public java.lang.String[] getDelimiters(boolean excludeAutofillingFields)
        CLO-5293: Returns an array of all field delimiters assigned to this field. In case no field delimiters are defined, default field delimiters from parent metadata are returned. Delimiters for last field are extended by a record delimiter. If excludeAutofillingFields is true (default for parsers), the last non-autofilled field is considered the last field.
        Parameters:
        excludeAutofillingFields -
        Returns:
        the array of all field delimiters

      • containsCarriageReturnInDelimiters

        public boolean containsCarriageReturnInDelimiters()
        Returns:
        true if any field delimiter contains a carriage return, false otherwise

      • setEofAsDelimiter

        public void setEofAsDelimiter(boolean eofAsDelimiter)
        Sets the EOF-as-delimiter flag.
        Parameters:
        eofAsDelimiter - the new value of the flag

      • isEofAsDelimiter

        public boolean isEofAsDelimiter()
        Returns:
        the value of the EOF-as-delimiter flag (last field inherits this flag from record)

      • setFormatStr

        public void setFormatStr(java.lang.String formatStr)
        Sets the format pattern of this data field.
        Parameters:
        formatStr - the new format pattern (acceptable value depends on the type of the data field)

      • getFormatStr

        public java.lang.String getFormatStr()
        This method should not be called directly, use getFormat(DataFieldFormatType) instead.
        Returns:
        the format pattern which will be used when outputting field's value as a string, or null if no format pattern is set for this field

      • isDateFormat

        public boolean isDateFormat()
        This method checks if formatString has a format of date. If formatString is null or empty then formatString hasn't a format of date. Note: formatString can has a format of date and format of time at the same time.
        Returns:
        true if formatString has a format of date, false otherwise
        Since:
        24th August 2007
        See Also:
        org.jetel.component.DataFieldmetadata.isTimeFormat(CharSequence)

      • isTimeFormat

        public boolean isTimeFormat()
        This method checks if formatString has a format of time. If formatString is null or empty then formatString hasn't a format of time. Note: formatString can has a format of date and format of time at the same time.
        Returns:
        true if formatString has a format of time, false otherwise
        Since:
        24th August 2007
        See Also:
        org.jetel.component.DataFieldmetadata.isDateFormat(CharSequence)

      • setSize

        public void setSize(int size)
        Sets the maximum field size (used only when dealing with a fixed-size type of record).
        Parameters:
        size - the new size of the data field

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Returns:
        the specified maximum field size (used only when dealing with a fixed-size type of record)

      • isDelimited

        public boolean isDelimited()
        Returns:
        true if this data field is delimited, false otherwise

      • isFixed

        public boolean isFixed()
        Returns:
        true if this data field is fixed-length, false otherwise

      • isByteBased

        public boolean isByteBased()
        Determines whether the field is byte-based.
        Returns:
        true if this data field is byte-based, false otherwise

      • hasFormat

        public boolean hasFormat()
        Returns:
        true iff formatStr is not null and is not empty

      • getFormatType

        public DataFieldFormatType getFormatType()
        Returns a type of a data field format obtained by analysis of a prefix of getFormarStr(). No prefix with a format type results in a default format type (DataFieldFormatType.DEFAULT_FORMAT_TYPE). Returns null for getFormatStr() being null or an empty string.
        Returns:
        a type of a data field format (or null if the field has no format)

      • getFormat

        public java.lang.String getFormat(DataFieldFormatType dataFieldFormat)
        Returns a formatting string of a given type. A purpose of this method is to prevent usage of incompatible formatting string types. The type of a formatting string is checked (using its prefix) - If the formatting string stored in meta-data has a different type, either an empty string is returned or conversion is performed. - If the formatting string stored in meta-data matches a type given in argument, the formatting string with no prefix is returned
        Parameters:
        dataFieldFormat -
        Returns:

      • getFormat

        public java.lang.String getFormat()
        Returns a formatting string of the default type (DataFieldFormatType.DEFAULT_FORMAT_TYPE). A purpose of this method is to prevent usage of incompatible formatting string types.

        Equivalent call:
        #getFormat(DataFieldFormatType.DEFAULT_FORMAT_TYPE)

        Parameters:
        dataFieldFormat -
        Returns:
        See Also:
        getFormat(DataFieldFormatType)

      • createDateFormatter

        public DateFormatter createDateFormatter()
        Prepare a DateFormatter instance based on format string and locale. Available only for date field metadata.
        Returns:
        DateFormatter instance for this date field metadata

      • setFieldProperties

        public void setFieldProperties(java.util.Properties properties)
        Sets the fieldProperties attribute of the DataRecordMetadata object. Field properties allows defining additional parameters for individual fields. These parameters (key-value pairs) are NOT normally handled by CloverETL, but can be used in user's code or Components - thus allow for greater flexibility.
        Parameters:
        properties - The new recordProperties value

      • getFieldProperties

        public TypedProperties getFieldProperties()
        Gets the fieldProperties attribute of the DataFieldMetadata object.
        These properties are automatically filled-in when parsing XML (.fmt) file containing data record metadata. Any attribute not directly recognized by Clover is stored within properties object.
        Example: 
         <Field name="Field1" type="numeric" delimiter=";" myOwn1="1" myOwn2="xyz" />
        Returns:
        The fieldProperties value
